intro: Grammica parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered grammica, is a herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, often with a slightly rough texture. Grammica parviflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or shaded meadows.
